Description: Fragment of wall and handle of East Greek grey ware pottery large vessel, probably dinos; metallic type spool handle attached to wall. Dirty-grayish slip on outside; traces of red paint.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 132 no. 373.2, pl. XL)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 239, no. 251)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.038)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5951 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
